sub_title: Experienced Program Manager in the Digital Workplace domain
summary:
Sander is an experienced and highly motivated consultant with strong analytical and communication skills in various organizational and technical areas. His trademark is his pragmatic approach and straight talk which is always focused on solving the issues at hand and aimed on tangible results.
Having started his career in technical functions he gained the experience he now uses in his project management and IT-consulting engagements.  The combination of these types of work and his technical background make Sander the perfect candidate for engagements where IT organization, processes and technology meet.  Sander is perceived as being a very experienced professional in the area of IT Management. IT supported business processes and the application of (innovative) technology.
His enthusiasm and focus on his client’s success often rubs off on the people he cooperates with inside or outside the team he is a member of.
It is our experience that both his clients and colleagues see drive, honesty and openness as typical characteristics for the way he works.

Specialties: ITIL, PrinceII, WWPMM, BiSL

certifications.name: The Open Group Certified: TOGAF® 9 Certified
Microsoft Certified: Security, Compliance, and Identity Fundamentals

projects.title: End User Computing Programme
projects.description:
o	Deliver IT improvements within the End User Computing domain and support the Pursuing Excellence Programme and the MIRU (new digital Media platform) Project with new IT solutions and services. 
o	Delivery of the latest Office365 services (Lync/Skype for Business, SharePoint online, OneDrive, Yammer and Office 2013) to all 18.000 employees in Europe, Middle East and Africa.
o	Migrate on premise SharePoint 2007 and 2010 environments to SharePoint 2013 on-line and decommission 2007 platforms.
o	Bring Your Own Device (BYOD) and Choose Your Own Device (CYOD) implementation to all employees in Europe, Middle East and Africa.
o	European End to End Network Improvements (Wifi, LAN, WAN, Internet breakouts) to support changed/increased network usage for mobile, video and cloud services.

projects.title: Lync 2010 @ Large international brewery
projects.description:
As a Lync Architect I’ve designed and implemented a global Lync Environment. Back-end integration with Sharepoint 2010, Exchange 2010, Polycom Video Conferencing systems and BlackBerry Enterprise Server. 
One of the locations has been upgraded from LCS 2005 to Lync (with OCS 2007 R2 as intermediate step). Performed the handover to management organization.
Expanded the environment to support 50.000 users.

volunteer_experiences.role: Office 365 Project Manager, Architect and Engineer
volunteer_experiences.description: Feasibility Study to and Implementation of Office 365 for non-profit organization Woman in Europe for a Common Future (WECF). WECF’s current IT infrastructure and applications that support their activities in the three WECF offices located in Utrecht (NL), Munich (DE) and Annemasse (FR) were roughly 5 years old and therefore in need of replacement. To the Point has been selected by WECF to, honorary, execute this Project and together To the Point and WECF have initiated a Project assessed the “as-is” for The Generic Office Automation Systems (file and print services, e-mail, calendar, managing current liabilities etc.), The Document Archiving Solution, including planning & contracts solutions and The Financial and Project Administration to determine how they can best be updated or replaced. The outcome of this is the implementation of Office 365 including, Lync-, Exchange- and SharePoint online. Lync was introduced next to Skype for internal communications and extended meeting support, while the three current mail systems (Local Exchange 2007, Internet POP/IMAP and French Office 365 tenant) where migrated to a new Office 365 tenant. For SharePoint a separate implementation plan (including taxonomy and training plan) was developed and existing documents where migrated to SharePoint Online
